20040000.text: You've come back safe and sound. Well done. Now let's...

20040001.text: Man, give me a break. I just got back a minute ago.

20040002.text: You've simply done what you must as the leader.

20040003.text:
Okay, okay, I get it. I'll go and report to my master. 
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, you're coming with me.

20040004.text: Ah, shouldn't you bring a little present with you before you meet the Great Elder?

20040005.text: A gift? That's a good idea. What would my teacher like?

20040006.text:
I know just the thing he'd love. 
You could perhaps resolve that <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hoglin</> problem... Or take care of the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Daybreak</>...

20040008.text:
If it's a problem for <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>, it's only natural that you be as interested in it as the leader. 
The Great Elder is also troubled by them, so handling them will make a fine gift for your visit.

20040009.text:
Fine. We should make it quick. 
Let's go, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>.

20040010.text: Sir? Is that you? What are you doing here?

20040011.text:
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Bi Ruha</> sent me. 
He told me to ask the leader about the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hoglin</> problem.

20040012.text:
Yes, I'm currently in charge of handling the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hoglin</> problem. 
I'm honored that the leader himself has come to resolve this. Let me explain our current situation.

20040013.text:
The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hoglins</> have been furious ever since the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sol Seeker</> Explorers failed to keep their promise. 
They've never attacked us before, but now they're attacking our members at the passage road.

20040014.text:
Those <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hoglins</> were always an angry bunch, 
but it's strange that they're attacking us. Did you find anything out?

20040015.text: Even the moderate <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hoglins</> were angry about the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sol Seekers</> situation. Fortunately, though, the leader of the moderates, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hogdon</>, was able to escape the group and asked us for help.

20040016.text:
Isn't <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hogdon</> <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hogcapo</>'s older brother? That's a surprise. 
I thought he'd be more aggressive than <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hogcapo</>, actually.

20040017.text:
So, where is <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hogdon</> now? 
I need to meet him and hear what he has to say.

20040018.text: Two of our men are protecting him. You can go and meet him.

20040020.text: Hello, sir! Once again, I'm at your service.

20040021.text:
At ease. There's no need for all the formality.
Your leader told me everything. Where's <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hogdon</>?

20040022.text: He's inside here. You can go in.

20040023.text: So, you're the leader of the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>?

20040024.text: Yeah, pleased to meet you. I'm <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Aran</>, the leader of the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>.

20040025.text: Who's this next to you? If you're not going to be of any help, you can leave.

20040026.text: Ah, this is my friend, <myHero.name/>. Don't worry. <myHero.name/> is legit.

20040027.text: Your word isn't good enough. I only believe what I can see for myself.

20040028.text: Guess you'll need to demonstrate what you can do, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>.

20040030.text: You're stronger than you look, punk.

20040032.text: Agreed. I thought <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hogcapo</> was the stronger one. I guess they’re brothers, after all.

20040033.text:
<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Capo</> is much stronger than I am. You know, one of <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Capo's</> men found a strange rock near this area.
Since then, <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Capo</> and his men have started acting pretty violent.

20040034.text:
Do you think that <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>strange rock</> might be <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</>? No, wait... <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</> doesn't make people violent. 
It must be <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Tectite</>...

20040036.text: It's not entirely clear, but I've heard stories that <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Tectite</> causes people to change in appearance or lose their minds.

20040037.text: We first need to check if the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hoglins</> have <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>it</>.

20040038.text:
Now, add this agent to a very delicious dish. This should weaken <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Capo</> so you can suppress him. 
I'll give you the location where <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Capo</> enjoys his mud bath.

20040039.text:
I never tried using this stuff because I wasn't sure I could beat him even if he was under its influence. 
Looks like there's nothing to worry about. Judging by your skills, the two of you should have no problem.

20040040.text: Okay, thanks. Leave it to us!

20040042.text: (<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hogcapo</> ate the food, just as planned.)

20040043.text: (<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hogcapo</> seems to be in a strange state!)

20040044.text: He certainly lives up to his name as the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hoglin Chief</>, even when he's weakened.

20040046.text: What are you doing? And where am I?

20040047.text:
Have you come back to your senses? Tell me about the rock you found a few years ago. 
That rock is the reason why you've been acting so strange!

20040049.text: Bingo! I think that's the one.

20040052.text:
Oh, my... It looks like <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hogdon</> had us use some kind of sleeping agent on him. 
The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hoglins</> will be on their way for sure since we made such a big ruckus. Let's destroy that rock and get out of here!

20040053.text: <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Hogdon</> sent me! He has another request.

20040055.text: He wants his men freed. While you're at it, he asked for you to also collect some weapons they can use.

20040056.text: Does he think we're here to run errands for him?

20040057.text: We should still help him out.

20040058.text: Fine, I understand. Well, since we're here, we might as well help them out.

20040060.text: Thanks for giving me a hand. I heard you destroyed the rock.

20040061.text:
Yup. We weren't sure if we could bring the rock here, so we just destroyed it. 
We'll see if that stops the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hoglins</> from acting violent.

20040062.text: When a mind is under that kind of influence, it won’t just go back to how it was before overnight. My men still aren't fully back to normal.

20040063.text: I guess time will tell. What's your plan now?

20040064.text:
Since the problem with the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hoglins</> is resolved, I'll do my best to handle the rest. 
I'll make sure the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</> isn't attacked anymore!

20040067.text: Hello, sir! Once again, I'm at your service.

20040068.text: For the second time, you all don't have to act so formal.

20040069.text: Understood. What business do you have here?

20040070.text:
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Bi Ruha</> told me that 
the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Daybreak</> are causing issues. How's the situation?

20040071.text:
They are more like fanatics who worship the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Sura</>. 
They're currently in a conflict with some <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</> combatants at <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Specter Hill</>.

20040072.text:
They worship the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Sura</>? That means we have no choice but to fight them. 
It looks like the solution is pretty simple this time, right, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>?

20040073.text: You can get a more detailed report from the squad leader at <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Specter Hill</>.

20040074.text: Okay. Let's go and give them a knuckle sandwich!

20040075.text:
Ah, welcome sir. 
I just received news from my superior. I'll explain the situation right away.

20040076.text:
Currently, our squad is fighting at the entrance to the hill. We don't know the current situation of the squad who broke through the entrance. 
And a few of us are being held captive deep inside the hill.

20040077.text: Please break through the entrance and join the squad inside. Then, all of you can work together to free the captured members.

20040078.text:
Hm. I get it. I just need to take everybody out, starting from the entrance. 
Should be a piece of cake!

20040081.text:
It's nothing, really. By the way, since when was the Daybreak such a powerful force? 
You must've had a tough time. This should keep them quiet for a while.

20040082.text: A lot of damage was done here.

20040083.text:
We don't know where they come from, but their reinforcements should arrive soon. 
We should leave the area, now that we've taken out what seemed to be their leader.

20040084.text:
Tsk. All right. I'd take them all out if I could, but everybody else is in such poor condition. 
Let's get back to the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>.

20040085.text: I'll take care of these guys for a while, so could you go ahead, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>?

20040087.text: Thanks. Then, let's get out quickly.

20040088.text:
I think it'd be best if we just jump off the cliff, rather than head back where we came from. 
Everybody, hold on to your wounded! Let's go!

20040090.text: (I should take care of the members and head to the cliff.)

20040092.text: I'll never agree to a plan that involves jumping off a cliff again...

20040093.text: Yeah, that's probably wise. Phew, let's go back to the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>.

20040094.text:
You're back. I heard about what you did out there. 
The Great Elder will also be pleased.

20040095.text: Stop teasing me. We barely made it. We also made one silly decision that put our men in danger.

20040096.text: Aww, how thoughtful of you! Preparing this gift must've been quite rewarding.

20040097.text: You really get a kick out of teasing me, don't you?

20040098.text: Let's go see our teacher. This gift we've prepared for him should put him in a good mood.

20040099.text: I think he would've been happy, even without that kind of present.

20040100.text: Is that so? Haha, Let's go, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>.

20040101.text: Father, do you really believe that one who only shows up when they need <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</> is truly worthy to become the leader?

20040102.text: It is the wish of the leader! How dare you question him!?

20040103.text: Leader, leader, leader! Why does he get to be one instead of me?

20040104.text: Father, you were the leader even before he was! Isn't it only natural that you pass on the title to your son?

20040105.text:
The title of master is not inherited by blood! Why do you still not understand that you must have the skill to prove your worthiness? 
This is why you are unfit to hold the title!

20040106.text: Skill? Ha! What a joke. Fine, I'll show you some of that skill you're talking about.

20040107.text: I'll bring you <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</> before he does! You'll have no choice, but to give me the title of the leader!

20040108.text: I guess we came at the wrong time.

20040110.text: How about you do a little sight-seeing around here? It won't take long.

20040111.text: I think I'll do just that.

20040112.text: All right, take your time. I'll see you later.

20040113.text: Just in time. Teacher, this is the friend I was talking about.

20040114.text: Ah, so you're our leader's colleague. It's a pleasure to meet you.

20040115.text: I've heard a lot about you, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Song Moonak</>. No need to be too formal with us.

20040116.text: I can't do that. I may have been his teacher, but now he is the clan leader and you are his colleague.

20040117.text: Always so strict on yourself. You haven't changed. That's the reason why <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Brother Sigook</> is so...

20040119.text: ...<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Sigook</> is headed for the old <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</> site in search of that giant <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</>.

20040120.text: But, the place is full of Hollows!

20040121.text:
I beg you. He may be lacking, but he is still my child. 
Please save Sigook, if only for my sake.

20040122.text: You don't need to do this. <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Brother Sigook</> is also my friend who I have grown up with.

20040126.text: I saw <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Brother Sigook</> running towards the cableway.

20040127.text: Cableway? Why would he go there...?

20040131.text: He took the cableway and headed for the Giant Caelite.

20040133.text: That's what we told him. But, he refused to listen to us.

20040134.text: Darn... We should hurry before it's too late.

20040136.text: We're going to take the cableway, too!

20040138.text: Excuse me. I'll head for the branch first.

20040139.text: There's nothing we can do here. Let's go back.

20040141.text: You know he didn't mean what he just said. He was on his knees to beg for his son's life. He can't be all right now.

20040142.text: Isn't there any way we can save him?

20040143.text: No... I don't know how. But...

20040146.text: What's that? <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</>? Where did <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Brother Sigook</> go?

20040147.text: It looks like someone took <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Brother Sigook</> and dropped this.

20040148.text: There aren't many people who have <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</>. That would mean... Ah! Man, that's just typical of my teacher, Moonak.

20040150.text:
It's obvious! My teacher came here and saved <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Brother Sigook</>. 
Why would he make such a fuss if he was going to come himself? Oh well, everything is fine now! I don't have to worry, right?

20040151.text: Something seems off... but all right.

20040152.text: Okay. Now that we have <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</>, and the problem's solved... Shall we continue where we left off?

20040154.text: You know! Our duel! You said if we duel with <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</>, it'll open up a Fissure.

20040156.text:
How about we go someplace better? 
Somewhere close to here... Yes, the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Crystal Jungle</> should do. I'll see you there!

20040157.text: How about a Windwalk race on the way? Let's do it!

20040161.text: Ouch... I'd like to ask you the same thing! Why are you interfering with our duel!?

20040162.text:
Your stupidity angers me to no end! How dare you, the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Reborn One</>, try to open up a Fissure!? 
How could you be so stupid after the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>rebirth</>!?

20040163.text:
Don't you say that so easily! 
You said this one's father is a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Sura</>! And that he killed <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Noi</>!

20040164.text: What does that have to do with this?

20040165.text:
I was trying to call the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Sura</> and find out! You never know. Maybe the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Sura</> who killed Noi might be called here. 
I might still learn something useful from any <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Sura</> we summon.

20040166.text: Even <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Noi</>'s child is still just a child. It may have been foolish of me to hold unreasonable expectations.

20040167.text:
This is my fault. 
As an <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Advocate</>, I'm not supposed to interfere with the matters of mortals. But, you are not a mere mortal. I suppose I could meddle a little here.

20040169.text: I'll find you when the time is right.

20040170.text: I'm going to go find some <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Caelite</> before <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Parsha</> comes back. What are you going to do?

20040171.text: I plan to do some training.

20040172.text: Oh, I'll be looking forward to it. Well then, take care of yourself!

20040173.text: You're back! Master, did you get...

20040174.text: Hahaha! I mean, we did train a lot...

20040175.text:
I know. You two have not neglected your training. 
I'm sure the Great Elder will be pleased.

20040178.text: (Let's use the ingredients Hong Donchil gave us)

20040179.text:
Whew. I also rescued the members of the clan who were caught on the way. 
We told you to gather around the Ten Commanders, so let's join.

20040183.text: I can feel the powerful energy around me!

20040185.text:
I can barely feel the aura of the death penalty...!?
Let's go this way!
